result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon J. Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars unless in furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Court re-imposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.

3:22 pm case called. Defendant Jon J. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by all parties. Attorney Johnson confirms receipt-no corrections or clarifications. DA Blader confirms-no clarifications or corrections. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 1-  146 days WCJ with credit for 110 days served. Count 2- 30 days WCJ concurrent to Count 1. Credit for 110 days served. Costs re-imposed as not previously paid. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-04-2015 03:15 pm

Case called @ 2:50 p.m. Defendant Jon J. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Johnson. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 mos probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars unless in furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. The defendant is eligible for expungment upon successful completion of probation.  Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-22-2015 02:30 pm
Status conference at 05-26-2015 09:50 am

2:09 pm case called. Defendant Jon D. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter scheduled for a suppression motion. Statement by DA Blader and video submitted to the court. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding motion and video submitted to the court. Further statement of DA Blader. Further statement by Attorney Johnson. Court marks video as exhibit #1 and receives into record. Court makes statement regarding video. Court denies the motion to suppress. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding cash confiscated during the warrant. Statement by DA Blader regarding cash confiscated during the search warrant execution. Court orders cash confiscated during the search warrant to be returned to the defendant within 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:50 am.

Case called @ 1:49 p.m. Defendant Jon J. Morgan in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  NG Plea entered. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Johnson. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. The defendant waives any conflict of interest with Atty Johnson representing both him and the co-defendant in this matter.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 03:10 pm.
